column2: New roads and railways should be built by private companies, not the government.
column3: New roads and railways should be built by the government, not private companies.

column2: Services like health care, education and social security should be provided by the government, not by private enterprise.
column3: Services like health care, education and social security should be provided by private enterprise, not by the government.

column2: Sometimes interest rates should be raised to reduce inflation, even if doing so would cause a large number of job losses.
column3: It's not worth raising interest rates to reduce inflation if this would result in the loss of large numbers of jobs.

column2: Drivers should pay enough tax to cover the cost of environmental damage caused by motor transport, even if that would price some people off the roads.
column3: Drivers shouldn't have to pay taxes to cover damage to the environment caused by motor transport, since that would price some people off the roads.

column2: The wealthy should pay a larger proportion of their income in tax than the poor.
column3: The wealthy shouldn't pay a larger proportion of their income in tax than the poor.

column2: The government should raise revenue by taxing consumption rather than income.
column3: The government should raise revenue by taxing income rather than consumption.

column2: Overall, economic migrants bring benefits to our country.
column3: Overall, economic migrants are a drain on our country.

column2: The government should subsidise farmers so that they stay in business, even if it would be cheaper to buy food from abroad.
column3: There's no need to subsidise farmers if we can buy food more cheaply from abroad, even if that meant they went out of business.
column4: economics, protectionism; society, importance of farming

column2: Smokers should be required to kick the habit before receiving medical care for smoking-related illnesses.
column3: Smokers should be able to receive medical care for smoking-related illnesses even if they still smoke.

column2: Everyone bears a moral responsibility for the actions of their government, even when they do not support them.
column3: Nobody bears a moral responsibility for actions of their government if they don't support them.

column2: Anybody who wants top-quality health care should expect to have to pay for it.
column3: Everybody has a right to top-quality health care, even if they aren't wealthy.

column2: The mix of minorities in public institutions should reflect their numbers in the general population.
column3: It doesn't matter whether the mix of minorities in public institutions reflects their numbers in the general population.

column2: Having individual local representatives is more important than electing parties in exact proportion to their support.
column3: It's more important that we elect parties in exact proportion to their support than that we each have individual local representatives.

column2: Officials like public prosecutors should be directly elected rather than chosen by the government.
column3: Officials like public prosecutors should be chosen by the government, not directly elected.

column2: For society to be cohesive, it is important that everyone shares a common language.
column3: A common language is not necessary for a cohesive society.

column2: Legal protection for free expression creates more trouble than it's worth.
column3: We should maintain the right to free expression, even if some people use it to create trouble.

column2: Nobody should go hungry, even if they refuse to work.
column3: People who refuse to work should run the risk of going hungry.

column2: Some art should receive government funding.
column3: Art shouldn't receive government funding.

column2: Our nation has a glorious history.
column3: Our nation's history is not particularly glorious.

column2: A person's social status shouldn't depend on who their parents are.
column3: A person's social status should depend on who their parents are.

column2: We should offer sanctuary to anybody fleeing persecution.
column3: We can't offer sanctuary to everyone who is fleeing persecution.

column2: There are some ethnic groups who can never be fully integrated into our society.
column3: People of any ethnic group can be fully integrated into our society.

column2: Everyone should stand up for the National Anthem.
column3: There is no reason to stand up for the National Anthem.

column2: Class distinctions should exist.
column3: Class distinctions should not exist.

column2: To protect society from drug abuse, narcotics must be banned.
column3: It is not necessary to ban narcotics to protect society from drug abuse.

column2: Alcohol is a more dangerous drug than marijuana.
column3: Marijuana is a more dangerous drug than alcohol.

column2: Shared religious beliefs should be an important part of our society.
column3: Shared religious belief isn't an important part of our society.

column2: Family is more important than society.
column3: Society is more important than family.

column2: Sometimes the only way to make a legitimate point of view heard is to break the law.
column3: It is never necessary to break the law to make a legitimate point of view heard.

column2: Our society needs more lawyers.
column3: Our society doesn't need any more lawyers.

column2: Some crimes are so serious that the only proper punishment is the death penalty.
column3: No crime, however serious, should be punished by death.

column2: Dealing with nuisance crimes like petty vandalism makes serious crime less likely.
column3: Dealing with nuisance crimes like petty vandalism doesn't make serious crime less likely.

column2: Everyone should have the right to trial by jury.
column3: Trial by jury shouldn't always be available by right.

column2: It's more important to rehabilitate criminals than to punish them.
column3: It's more important to punish criminals than to rehabilitate them.

column2: It is only acceptable to use proportionate force to defend your property from criminals.
column3: It is acceptable to use any amount of force you choose to defend your property from criminals.

column2: Members of our society should be familiar with the history and traditions of our culture.
column3: Members of society needn't be familiar with the history and traditions of our culture.

column2: Overall, young people benefit from compulsory military service.
column3: Overall, young people don't benefit from compulsory military service.

column2: Schools should concentrate on training people for the workforce.
column3: Schools should do much more than just training people for the workforce.

column2: Schools should not teach children anything which contradicts their parents' religious faith.
column3: Sometimes schools should teach children things which contradict their parents' religious faith.

column2: Some people should not have access to the Internet.
column3: Everyone should have access to the Internet.

column2: Correct grammar is important.
column3: Correct grammar doesn't matter.

column2: Scientists bear no moral responsibility for how their discoveries are used.
column3: Scientists bear a moral responsibility for how their discoveries are used.

column2: Some technologies should never be used, whatever their benefits.
column3: We should make use of any technology, if it benefits us.

column2: Some medical research would require so many animal experiments that it should not be done, whatever the benefits.
column3: Beneficial medical research should always go ahead, however many animal experiments would be performed

column2: Religious faith should be based on the literal word of God.
column3: Religious faith needn't be based on the literal word of God.

column2: There is a place for organised religion in government.
column3: There is no place for organised religion in government.

column2: There are some sexual acts which are immoral, even between consenting adults.
column3: There is no such thing as an immoral sexual act between consenting adults.

column2: It is immoral to be lazy.
column3: Laziness is not immoral.

column2: It is never moral to break the law.
column3: Breaking the law is not always immoral.

column2: No woman should be allowed to have an abortion, whatever the circumstances.
column3: Abortion is acceptable in some cases.

column2: National law should always override international agreements.
column3: Sometimes international agreements should override national law.

column2: Sometimes civilians are a legitimate military target.
column3: Civilians are never a legitimate military target.

column2: The people of this country have a very different character to those of our neighbours.
column3: Fundamentally, the people of this country have the same character as those of our neighbours.

column2: Aid projects abroad should always be funded by charities, not the taxpayer.
column3: Some overseas aid projects should be funded by the taxpayer, and can't be left to charities.

column2: It's acceptable for a businessman to bribe a foreign official to complete a sale.
column3: It's unacceptable for a businessman to bribe a foreign official to complete a sale.

column2: Our armed forces should intervene to stop genocide in other countries.
column3: Our armed forces shouldn't intervene in other countries, even to stop genocide.

column2: Our sense of right and wrong comes from religious faith.
column3: We don't need religious faith to have a sense of right and wrong.

column2: Children should always obey their parents.
column3: Sometimes children shouldn't obey their parents.

column2: In the right circumstances, cutting taxes can increase government revenue.
column3: Cutting taxes can't ever increase government revenue.

column2: Economic globalisation will increase inequality.
column3: Economic globalisation will decrease inequality.

column2: It's more important to make the poor richer than to decrease the gap between rich and poor.
column3: It's more important to decrease the gap between rich and poor than to make the poor richer.

column2: There is a danger that some large corporations will become more powerful than governments.
column3: Governments will always be more powerful than large corporations.

column2: Aggressive foreign policies can put a stop to international terrorism.
column3: Aggressive foreign policies will not put a stop to international terrorism.

column2: Drug abuse is a problem primarily because of its effects on drug users, not its effects on the rest of society.
column3: Drug abuse is a problem primarily because of its effects on society, not its effects on drug users alone.

column2: The only way for some workers to achieve fair pay is through collective bargaining.
column3: Workers don't need to resort to collective bargaining to achieve fair pay.

column2: Nobody should be sacked for going on strike.
column3: Sometimes it's necessary to sack people who go on strike.

column2: Small businesses are more important to the economy than large corporations.
column3: Large corporations are more important to the economy than small businesses.

column2: The government should act to stop companies paying executives excessive salaries.
column3: Companies should be free to pay their executives any salary, however large.

column2: Workers in the public sector should be paid as much as those doing similar jobs in private industry.
column3: Workers in the public sector shouldn't expect to earn as much as those doing similar jobs in private industry.
